summary: Not April Fools, I hate the day, but
body:
Not April Fools, I hate the day, but

what if the forthcoming Travel-Con is The Traveler telling his followers, “On this day, I’m declaring it to be Fools Day. Every prank, joke, vandalism, jaywalking, whatever will be extra blessed. Spread the word, put it on Ye Olde Craig’s List, send messenger pigeons. Go hog wild, my children.”

blog.name: critical-misadventures
blog.title: Critical Misadventures
blog.description:
Just a cute non-binary nerd doing a fan comic about Critical Role. I don't own any of these characters, of course (some of them are real people), except for the bad guys. I have a FAQ page now! If you're on the tumblr app, search #faq.
- COMISSIONS CLOSED -

summary: (you're my) you're my underscore, my kite in a thunderstorm
title: (you're my) you're my underscore, my kite in a thunderstorm
body:
Caleb is not sick. He is not sick, because he is one of the most accomplished wizards in Wildemount, a master of the arcane, a wielder of terrible magic beyond the comprehension of the vast majority of mortal minds, a battlemage with blood-drenched hands, a war criminal, a force to be reckoned with, and forces to be reckoned with don’t get colds.

rating: t
word count: 1,741

read on ao3

blog.name: vicious-molly-maukery
blog.title: because i’m weird
blog.description: Lover of all things Critical Role related

body:
OKAY SO Y’ALL

it occurs to me that the animatic that came out today might have been shot BEFORE the kickstarter even opened. like in the introductory “ad” for the kickstarter and then the holy shit impromptu day one of kickstarter Q&A didn’t they mention that they had already put together a lot of BTS footage to tease for stretch goals and stuff? so possibly the thinking behind this particular bit could’ve been “hey see how cool this could be!? i mean yeah obviously april fools and haha we’re hilarious but also let’s pay homage to a wildly successful and beloved cartoon whilst simultaneously showing you how completely jazzed we are and look at all these possibilities please donate so we can maybe do it!” because they didn’t even know that they’d be double and a half their wildest dream stretch goal WITH SEVENTEEN DAYS STILL TO GO.

TLDR: i accidentally made myself emotional about an april fools joke.

summary: i honestly wonder what happened between campaign 1 and 2 in terms of their politics. campaign 1 is by no means an epitome of...
body:
i honestly wonder what happened between campaign 1 and 2 in terms of their politics. campaign 1 is by no means an epitome of sexism and misogyny and still miles better than most fantasy tbh, but there is still an awful lot of talk abt wh*res, scanlan is a shitshow tbh and matt occasionally falls into fairly sexist and sometimes homophobic/transphobic tropes w npcs (CN transphobia but for example “slimy” male villains in make-up being evil manipulators lacking integrity). its not like they’re ~deliberately sexist but rather a general background noise that you’d expect pop cultural show to have, based on the society we live in, just within the fantasy and sci fi frame. 

but campaign 2 is honestly incredible in that regard? its not only almost completely free from all sexism and homophobia and transphobia, it’s also actively fighting back against that crap???? who sat them down and had a good chat w them about it???????

but campaign 2 is honestly incredible in that regard? its not only almost completely free from all sexism and homophobia and transphobia, it’s also actively fighting back against that crap???? who sat them down and had a good chat w them about it???????

but campaign 2 is honestly incredible in that regard? its not only almost completely free from all sexism and homophobia and transphobia, it’s also actively fighting back against that crap???? who sat them down and had a good chat w them about it???????

summary: My mighty nein superpowers headcanons  Beau: super speed, monks can move fast and have ways of moving even faster plus the hast...
question: My mighty nein superpowers headcanons  Beau: super speed, monks can move fast and have ways of moving even faster plus the hast spell has been used on her a lot  Jester: super strength, self explanatory  Fjord: illusions, specifically but possibly not limited to making himself look different  Nott: telekinesis, because of the use of her mage hand  Caleb: fire, self explanatory  Caduceus: healing with an knack for nature or vice versa  Yasha: lighting, stormlord, probably the most far-fetched one
answer:
super power au hell yeah, i am into it my dude

beau: i agree on that, she’s definitely a speedster, although i think it’d be interesting if she has some sort of latent empath- related powers, that jester or cad could help her figure out

jester: super strength of course, but also something empathy-related, she can sense other people’s emotions/manipulate emotions

fjord: some sort of psychic persuasion, hypnosis maybe, and i love the illusions as a secondary power

nott: enhanced senses, i think- hearing/smell specifically, not sight, and maybe some illusory stuff

caleb: fire, yes, but also he can talk to animals! i just need frumpkin’s sarcastic commentary on his disaster wizard

caduceus: healing actually wasn’t my first thought when it came to him, but yeah that seems super obvious. empath, maybe a minor affinity for plants

yasha: flight. you know i gotta have those wings, but also maybe she can control storms in some way

molly: minor divination powers! he can sense the future, and also maybe some kind of shapeshifting/appearance alteration
